title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
In some editions Friday, a Page One article about the Supreme Court lifting the latest federal moratorium on evictions misspelled Justice Brett Kavanaugh's surname as Kavanugh.

---

The Taliban took years to regroup after 2001. A Page One article Friday about the group's battle with Afghanistan's Islamic State affiliate incorrectly said the Taliban took years to regroup after 2011.

(See: "Bombings Reveal Hidden Afghan War" -- WSJ Aug. 27, 2021)

---

Quotes attributed to Salesforce.com CEO Marc Benioff in a Heard on the Street column Friday about the company took place during Salesforce's first-quarter conference call in May. The column incorrectly attributed the quotes to the company's second-quarter call on Wednesday.

(See: "Heard on the Street: Salesforce Needs to Stay Course" -- WSJ Aug. 27, 2021)

---

WeWork had $215 million in revenue in July, up from $209 million in June. A Property Report article on Wednesday about shared office spaces incorrectly said WeWork's revenue in July was up $209 million from June.

(See: "The Property Report: Shared Office Spaces Get a Boost --- WeWork, others post rise in summer sales as uncertainty remains on workplace returns" -- WSJ Aug. 25, 2021)

---

Notice to readers

Wall Street Journal staff members are working remotely during the pandemic. For the foreseeable future, please send reader comments only by email or phone, using the contacts below, not via U.S. Mail.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
